column1: - Allocation Benefit for including the illiquid asset is large but declines sharply with more that 2 years of waiting time to trade.
- the Allocation to  the liquid assets barely moves. Cash buffers build up.
- the cost of diversification however is the higher dispersion of xi. Overallocation to the illiquid asset occurs much more often and to a larger extend.
-the lower the correlation, the less the investor can use the liquid asset to hedge movements in the illiquid one. the higher the dispersion in consumption
- No substitution effect. The investor is exposed more to illiquidity risk, in the form of reducing consumption below the alternative (no investment in the illiquid asset)
